TopicTitle: Changing parts in the save file

Articles.Content:
Hi all,

 Does anyone know how to change parts in the save file? I have a part I want to change for another one and I don't want to rebuild the craft.

Cheers.

Yeah dude it's super easy. Open the .craft with a text editor. Then ctrl + find and replace all the part you want to replace with the new one.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-08-07T15:51:25Z" title="08/07/2015 03:51  PM" data-short="8 yr">August 7, 2015</time> by clown\_baby**

> 
> Yeah dude it's super easy. Open the .craft with a text editor. Then ctrl + find and replace all the part you want to replace with the new one.

Sweet, thanks! Fingers crossed it works!

Ok I changed the part name and now in the VAB I cannot open the craft load menu.... 

 I only changed the name in one craft file! EEEEP. Any ideas?

- - - Updated - - -

Ok, changing the name stopped the game loading any craft in the VAB. I deleted the changed file and all is well. I really need detailed instructions if anyone knows?

Thanks.

I have no idea why that would have happened. I've done this before without any problems. It was a couple ksp versions ago. You could send me the .craft if you want me to try.

I don't think their were any other steps besides replacing the part with Ctrl f.

> 
> I have no idea why that would have happened. I've done this before without any problems. It was a couple ksp versions ago. You could send me the .craft if you want me to try.
> I don't think their were any other steps besides replacing the part with Ctrl f.

Thanks man, I took the hard route and just rebuilt the thing..

> 
> Thanks man, I took the hard route and just rebuilt the thing..

That sucks. But I like rebuilding my crafts from scratch a couple times. They always end up better.

> 
> That sucks. But I like rebuilding my crafts from scratch a couple times. They always end up better.

Yeah it sucked at first, but it's much better now. Thanks man.

okay, then I hijack this thread and ask:

how do I change a part in a vessel the persistent.cfg (I do know, how it works with single part ships as in the recover kerbal missions, where kerbals were stuck in probe cores)?

situation: I play with the MKS mods and the planet mod new horizons (and a few other mods). I have space stations in various orbits equipped with the MKS-dockingports (kerbitrail), which don't work.

I'd like to change them (all) into standard clamp-o-trons.

otherwise I fly to them with a claw + dockingport-combination. (dock to the station, and when I leave, the claw + docking port remains at the station for further visiting ships).

> 
> okay, then I hijack this thread and ask:
> how do I change a part in a vessel the persistent.cfg (I do know, how it works with single part ships as in the recover kerbal missions, where kerbals were stuck in probe cores)?
> 
> situation: I play with the MKS mods and the planet mod new horizons (and a few other mods). I have space stations in various orbits equipped with the MKS-dockingports (kerbitrail), which don't work.
> 
> I'd like to change them (all) into standard clamp-o-trons.
> 
> otherwise I fly to them with a claw + dockingport-combination. (dock to the station, and when I leave, the claw + docking port remains at the station for further visiting ships).

If you find the vessel (search by name in the sfs file) you can change a part by replacing a PART { } section with one that works for Clamp-O-Trons.

Your best bet would be to "launch" the craft you want to change but with clamp-o-trons in place of the kerbirails. Then save, and copy the PART { } for the clamp-o-tron over from that craft to the one in orbit. (replacing the kerbitrail one). 

You could also try the universal docking ports mod:

[http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/73005-1-0-x-Kip-Engineering-All-Ports-and-Hubs-fixed-and-updated-for-1-0-x!-(2nd-May-2015)](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/73005-1-0-x-Kip-Engineering-All-Ports-and-Hubs-fixed-and-updated-for-1-0-x!-%282nd-May-2015%29)

With this plugin:

[http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/79128](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/79128)

which should make all docking ports universal.
Just leaving a quick note so that y'all know I've moved this into the main Gameplay Questions forum. Carry on ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
